alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Roane; Taylor; Upshur; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, northwestern Randolph, Upshur, south central Wirt, Roane, north central Webster, Barbour, southern Harrison, Taylor, Gilmer, Lewis, Braxton and north central Clay Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pleasant Valley to 9 miles west of Stonewall Jackson to 6 miles east of Sandyville. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Elkins, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Philippi, Spencer, Glenville, Sutton, Grantsville, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Belington, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Gassaway, Anmoore, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park and Big Otter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 22 and 129. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 78 and 82. Route 19 near mile marker 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Roane; Taylor; Upshur; Wirt
